channel.title: Domains With Ulmb
channel.description:
i bought a .com domain and set the target for ns1.unlimitedmb.com and ns2.unlimitedmb.com how do i get this to work with my forums then? with ulmb.com heres the message i get
directory index not allowed please upload a file named index.html or index.php into this directory to replace this message If you can still see this page after uploading your index file press CTRL+F5 now.

item.title: Domains With Ulmb
item.dc:creator: @Aaron2 Aaron;
item.description:
@Aaron2 wrote:

[quote=“si force, post:5, topic:201853”]Being honest ulmb sucks balls,
They banned me for no reason at all.[/quote] just the people do, the host owns, but the prem package, woohooo!

Read full topic

item.title: Domains With Ulmb
item.dc:creator: @dragonchain dragonchain
item.description:
@dragonchain wrote:

[quote=“Eh Pretty Easy, post:2, topic:201853”]forward your ulmb site to your domain and make a new index.html file then put this inside of it for now…

Tranquil Tranquil testing!

after that upload it through ftp to your root dir.[/quote]Eh pretty easy

Read full topic

item.title: Domains With Ulmb
item.dc:creator: @god_of_ikiliki god of ikiliki
item.description:
@god_of_ikiliki wrote:

Set the DNS like you did, and add your antisilab.com domain to your ulmb account.
ns1.unlimitedmb.com and ns2.unlimitedmb.com are not domain names for your ulmb account only

Read full topic

item.title: Domains With Ulmb
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

forward your ulmb site to your domain and make a new index.html file then put this inside of it for now…

Tranquil Tranquil testing!

after that upload it through ftp to your root dir.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Tranquil wrote:

i bought a .com domain and set the target for ns1.unlimitedmb.com and ns2.unlimitedmb.com
how do i get this to work with my forums then?
with ulmb.com

heres the message i get

directory index not allowed please upload a file named index.html or index.php into this directory to replace this message

If you can still see this page after uploading your index file press CTRL+F5 now.
